name: bear
trans: to carry, support or maintain something

name: pressure
trans: worry and fear caused by the feeling that you have too many responsibilities and cares

name: struggle
trans: make forceful or violent efforts to get free of restraint or constriction.

name: progress
trans: develop in a positive way

name: persist
trans: to continue to exist past the usual time, or to continue to do something in a determined way even when facing difficulties or opposition

name: dire
trans: very serious or extreme

name: approximately
trans: close to a particular number or time although not exactly that number or time

name: academic
trans: relating to schools, esp. colleges and universities, or connected with studying and thinking and not with useful skills

name: inordinate
trans: unreasonably or unusually large in size or degree

name: equality
trans: the right of different groups of people to receive the same treatment

name: absence
trans: the state of not being somewhere, or a period in which you are not somewhere

name: devote
trans: to dedicate something to something else

name: frustration
trans: disappointment or discouragement, or a discouraging situation

name: discrepancy
trans: an unexpected difference, esp. in two amounts or two sets of facts or conditions, which suggests that something is wrong and has to be explained

name: mentor
trans: an experienced and trusted person who gives another person advice and help, esp. related to work or school, over a period of time

name: invaluable
trans: extremely useful

name: guidance
trans: help and advice about how to do something or about how to deal with problems

name: validate
trans: to make something officially acceptable or approved

name: funding
trans: money made available for a particular purpose

name: commensurate
trans: suitable in amount or quality compared to something else; matching in degree
